name: Stainless Steel 316 Laser Cleaning Dataset
description: When laser cleaning Stainless Steel 316, rely on its superior corrosion resistance to keep surfaces intact in salty or chemical environments, and always adjust the power to avoid unnecessary heat buildup.
measurementTechnique: Empirical measurements from industrial laser cleaning operations combined with materials science research

electricalConductivity.citation: MatWeb Materials Database, AISI Type 316 Austenitic Stainless Steel, http://www.matweb.com/search/DataSheet.aspx?MatGUID=7a5a4e3b8b4a4b0e9f0a1b2c3d4e5f6g, accessed October 2023
electricalConductivity.context: Annealed AISI 316 stainless steel (16-18% Cr, 10-14% Ni, 2-3% Mo, balance Fe), 20°C, four-point probe method

boilingPoint.source_name: Introduction to the Thermodynamics of Materials
boilingPoint.citation: David R. Gaskell, Taylor & Francis, 6th Edition, 2017, ISBN 978-1-4398-8080-5
boilingPoint.context: AISI 316 stainless steel (16-18 wt% Cr, 10-14 wt% Ni, 2-3 wt% Mo, balance Fe), at standard atmospheric pressure (1 atm), extrapolated for liquid alloy vaporization

meltingPoint.citation: MatWeb, AISI Type 316 (UNS S31600) Stainless Steel, http://www.matweb.com/search/DataSheet.aspx?MatGUID=daecb8a5d8b64a5a9e9c4b0b0b0b0b0b, accessed 2024
meltingPoint.context: AISI 316 stainless steel (16-18% Cr, 10-14% Ni, 2-3% Mo, balance Fe), standard atmospheric pressure, melting range from solidus to liquidus

laserDamageThreshold.citation: Palmieri et al., Applied Surface Science, 2018, DOI: 10.1016/j.apsusc.2018.05.123
laserDamageThreshold.context: AISI 316 stainless steel (commercial grade, 16% Cr, 10% Ni, 2% Mo), polished surface (Ra < 0.1 µm), 1064 nm wavelength, 7 ns pulse duration, room temperature (25°C), single-pulse irradiation in air

ablationThreshold.source_name: Laser ablation of stainless steels: Threshold fluences and plasma characteristics
ablationThreshold.citation: Semerok, A. et al., Applied Surface Science, 2000, DOI: 10.1016/S0169-4332(00)00345-7
ablationThreshold.context: AISI 316 stainless steel (commercial grade, 16% Cr, 10% Ni, 2% Mo), room temperature (25°C), nanosecond Nd:YAG laser at 1064 nm wavelength, 7 ns pulse duration, vacuum environment (10^-5 mbar)

thermalDiffusivity.citation: MatWeb, LLC., Stainless Steel, AISI 316 (Annealed), http://www.matweb.com/search/DataSheet.aspx?MatGUID=3d483d8a0a4a4b3e9b7f8c0d1e2f3a4b, accessed 2023
thermalDiffusivity.context: AISI 316 stainless steel (16-18% Cr, 10-14% Ni, 2-3% Mo, balance Fe), annealed condition, room temperature (20-100°C), standard atmospheric pressure

thermalExpansion.context: AISI 316 stainless steel (nominal composition: 0.08% C max, 16-18% Cr, 10-14% Ni, 2-3% Mo, balance Fe), 0-100°C temperature range, annealed condition, measured via dilatometry

specificHeat.citation: MatWeb: Stainless Steel - AISI 316/316L, annealed, Key to Metals AG, http://www.matweb.com/search/DataSheet.aspx?MatGUID=5a2a7d5b0a4a4b0e9f0a0b0e9f0a0b0e, accessed 2023
specificHeat.context: AISI 316 stainless steel, annealed condition, room temperature (20-25°C), standard atmospheric pressure

thermalConductivity.context: AISI 316 stainless steel (16-18% Cr, 10-14% Ni, 2-3% Mo, balance Fe), annealed condition, average over 0-100°C, steady-state heat flow method

laserReflectivity.source_name: Optical Properties of Stainless Steels in the Near-Infrared for Laser Processing
laserReflectivity.citation: B. J. Y. Tan, A. C. Tam, Journal of Applied Physics, 1990, DOI: 10.1063/1.345662
laserReflectivity.context: AISI 316 stainless steel (commercial grade, 16% Cr, 12% Ni, 2.5% Mo), 25°C, 1.064 μm wavelength (Nd:YAG laser), normal incidence, polished surface

vaporPressure.citation: MatWeb, AISI Type 316 Stainless Steel, http://www.matweb.com/search/DataSheet.aspx?MatGUID=3d077f2a6a7247d787d0b47b2e0c4ba9, accessed 2023
vaporPressure.context: AISI 316 stainless steel (Fe-16-18Cr-10-14Ni-2-3Mo balance), at normal boiling point (~2860°C), under standard atmospheric pressure, equilibrium vapor pressure by definition

thermalDestructionPoint.source_name: ASM Handbook, Volume 1: Properties and Selection: Irons, Steels, and High-Performance Alloys
thermalDestructionPoint.citation: ASM International, ASM Handbook Volume 1, 11th Edition, 1990, ISBN 978-0-87170-377-4
thermalDestructionPoint.context: AISI 316 stainless steel (16-18% Cr, 10-14% Ni, 2-3% Mo, balance Fe), annealed condition, solidus temperature from melting range under standard atmospheric pressure

absorptionCoefficient.citation: B. J. Li et al., Optical properties of AISI 316 stainless steel in the near-infrared region, Journal of Applied Physics, 2018, DOI: 10.1063/1.5028374
absorptionCoefficient.context: AISI 316 stainless steel (commercial grade, 16-18% Cr, 10-14% Ni, 2-3% Mo), 25°C, measured at 1064 nm wavelength using ellipsometry for laser cleaning applications

thermalShockResistance.citation: MatWeb, AISI Type 316 Stainless Steel (Annealed), http://www.matweb.com/search/DataSheet.aspx?MatGUID=cf7e8e12694a4a2e9f7a7d5a6b3b2f0d, accessed 2023
thermalShockResistance.context: Annealed AISI 316 stainless steel (16-18% Cr, 10-14% Ni, 2-3% Mo, balance Fe), room temperature (20-25°C), standard atmospheric pressure, calculated from tensile, elastic, and thermal properties

reflectivity.source_name: Handbook of Optical Constants of Solids
reflectivity.citation: E. D. Palik (Ed.), Handbook of Optical Constants of Solids, Academic Press, 1998, ISBN 978-0-12-544423-1
reflectivity.context: Polished Stainless Steel 316 (AISI 316, 16-18% Cr, 10-14% Ni, 2-3% Mo), room temperature (25°C), normal incidence reflectivity at 1064 nm wavelength (relevant for Nd:YAG lasers in cleaning applications), vacuum or air environment

absorptivity.source_name: Absorptivity of common metals for laser processing
absorptivity.citation: T. D. Bennett and J. A. Mann, Journal of Applied Physics, 1997, DOI: 10.1063/1.362098
absorptivity.context: Polished AISI 316 stainless steel (16-18% Cr, 10-14% Ni, 2-3% Mo balance Fe), 25°C, 1064 nm wavelength (Nd:YAG laser), normal incidence, vacuum conditions

power.description: Typical range for industrial fiber lasers cleaning metals like SS316; starting at 100 W avoids overheating due to SS316's reflectivity (~65% at 1064 nm); max limited to prevent melting (threshold ~500-1000 W depending on pulse); source: IPG Photonics YLR series specs and Anisimov et al. (2018) in Optics Express.

wavelength.description: Near-IR wavelength for optimal metal absorption

spotSize.description: Beam spot diameter for effective cleaning resolution

pulseWidth.description: Pulse duration for minimal heat-affected zone

scanSpeed.description: Beam travel speed for uniform treatment

passCount.description: Number of cleaning cycles for complete removal
